intro: Erigeron × celakovskyi, commonly known as the hybrid fleabane, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which typically feature white petals and a yellow center. The plant has finely divided, gray-green leaves and is native to the central and eastern United States. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open fields and along roadsides. Erigeron × celakovskyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
